text: The arrondissement of Châtellerault is an arrondissement of France, in the Vienne department, Nouvelle-Aquitaine region. Its capital is the city of Châtellerault. ==History== When the Vienne department was created on 1800, the arrondissement of Châtellerault was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Châtellerault is in northern Vienne and is bordered to the northwest by the Maine-et-Loire department, to the north and east by the Indre-et-Loire department, to the southeast by the Indre department (a small part) and the arrondissement of Montmorillon, to the south by the arrondissement of Poitiers and to the west by the Deux-Sèvres department. It has an area of . It has 112,313 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Châtellerault, there are 4 cantons whose communes are in the arrondissement: Châtellerault-1, Châtellerault-2, Châtellerault-3 and Loudun. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Châtellerault INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Châtellerault Montmorillon Poitiers 8602 Châtellerault-1 7 + part of Châtellerault 7 + part of Châtellerault 8603 Châtellerault-2 20 + part of Châtellerault 20 + part of Châtellerault 8604 Châtellerault-3 10 + part of Châtellerault 10 + part of Châtellerault 8605 Chauvigny 7 8 15 8607 Jaunay-Clan 1 7 8 8608 Loudun 49 49 8612 Montmorillon 1 25 26 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Châtellerault has 92 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes)ː #
